name: Don Laughlin's Riverside Resort

reviews.text: Took the package deal out of Des Moines to celebrate my wifes birthday. It was an outstanding trip and stay. We are now planning to go on another flight in August to celebrate my birthday. That should tell you what we thought of our experience. Thank You, Don!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
reviews.title: Three Great days
Not our cup of tea...
reviews.text: We were taking a "road trip" and had heard about Laughlin over the years. So, on our way to Las Vegas, we decided to spend two nights there. We only stayed at this hotel because my folks love it and would have been heart broken if we stayed anywhere else. I guess I have to be up-front and say that we usually stay at the Mirage in Las Vegas and we did know better than to try and equate the Riverside with that. However...

reviews.title: Great time, Wonderful view, clean fresh room.
reviews.text: When we checked in they charged us two dollars for each room key. Then she told us that their key machine wasn't working so we could not use them to get into our room anyway! She said Security would have to meet us at our room to let us in. So we headed towards the elevator to get up to the tenth floor. There was a bank of three elevators. The middle one would not work at all. The one we finally got in to groaned and screeched so much that I had my heart in my throat! Security never showed up to let us in so we had to flag down a cleaning lady and have her call Security again. They finally showed.

reviews.title: Being taken care of at the Riverside
reviews.text: When we got in the room, it was very clean, and very dated with a couple dusty plastic plants hanging around. The cold and hot water faucets were switched but we got used to that okay.

reviews.title: Always a great stay
reviews.text: It was sunny out so we decided to go to the pool. There were very few people there. The only way to get something to drink was a pop machine...but it was broken. So, when we left the pool area, I told my husband that we should grab a couple pops from the machine on our floor. We wandered down to it and...guess what...it was broken...

reviews.title: A Great place to vacation
reviews.text: I have read the other reviews on this thread. I am here to tell you, some of them are totally inaccurate. I was there in July of 2005, during the hottest part of the season and the casino was very comfortable, A/C wise. My wife and I are both non smokers and we had no problem at all with smoke in the casino or in our room. The rooms were super clean and of course they have hair dryers and all the normal amenities.

reviews.title: Not the best place to stay in Laughlin
reviews.text: The help were all outgoing and friendly.

reviews.title: Nice surprise.
reviews.text: There are several good restaurants, covering all price ranges, as well as a movie theatre, bowling alley, and Vegas quality shows.

reviews.title: enjoyed room and veiw
reviews.text: A super outdoor swimming pool, for fun in the sun.

reviews.title: Better than expected. Antiques and White trash excluded
reviews.text: We got all this for $259 a person, including round trip flight (from Madison, WI), baggage handling, 3 nights lodging in a good size room with an excellent view of the Colorado river and the mountains in Arizona. We also got coupons for 50% off on the show and the boat trip.

I arrived home late last evening from a 3 day trip to the Riverside Hotel from Fargo, ND. with my sister....It was one of their package deals...I was pleased to say for a large group this was a very well organized trip and we enjoyed the whole thing....I will say the food isn't the greatest at the Riverside, but everything else was fine. For the $$ I would surely recommend it to people for a short stay..The flight on Sun Country went smooth and we were early both leaving and coming home..I would do it again...No big wins on the "slots", but did have a little luck and enjoyed our stay.
reviews.title: Very well organized trip

reviews.text: The hotel was great, the casino nice , the buffet was great, but the Riverside cafe service was the worst I've ever had.
reviews.title: Riverside Cafe

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked a stay and asked for pet friendly room-we were advised that the room would be in old building. It was an old building and the rooms were smoking allowed, entire building and room smelled like old smoke. We were not advised about the smoking. Room was not clean, hair on sheets and bed, could not open sliding door in room. We left and moved on, not a place to stay with a small pet. Would not go back. On the plus side staff was very friendly and did not hesitate to provide refund.
reviews.title: Not a good place to stay with pets!

reviews.text: Pet area in need of better cleanliness and deodorizing. Did not honor requested room so had to stay there. All eating facilities food was cold, under cooked and unappealing. I love the Bingo staff!! The Bingo room is clean and the coffee is fresh. The casino is dingy and overcrowded.
reviews.title: Dissappointing and worse since last January, Deplorable cleanliness and food quality.

reviews.text: My mom and I are coming back for our third trip. Both of us can't say enough good things about the great times we have there. From the great deal on air and room to the deals you get on food and drinks, we will keep coming back. We tell everyone we know about the great deal and fun we have when we are there. We work with Lucy and she takes great care of us, she is great. The view from our room loking over the river in fantastic. From one Minnesotan to another, thanks Don.
reviews.title: I will keep coming back
A special casino and hotel
reviews.text: Stayed at most of the hotels in Laughlin but still opt for the Riverside who have treated us very well.

reviews.title: Another Great Trip
reviews.text: This was our 4th trip to the Riverside, our first flying from Little Rock. It was a 3 night stay. Our charter jet was full and although it departed about 30 minutes late, we arrived right on time. As advertised, the Riverside buses were there to pick us up and yes, they did deliver our baggage to our room within the timeframe promised. Our room key and new slot cards were waiting for us. We were on the 18th floor this trip and I thought our room was even better than we'd had before. It was very clean (one exception is that the housekeeping staff doesn't wipe off the windows very often, so there were palm and nose prints on the glass,) the bathroom large and it included a hairdryer. The bed was very comfortable and the sheets fit properly (this is often a problem in hotels.) The Riverside has added a great variety of new slot machines in the last couple of years, which was fun and kept us busy. Slots weren't necessarily tight, but we didn't win a whole lot. That's the risk you take when you gamble. Food was excellent and we were comp'd all of our meals except one that first night. We paid a grand total of $14 for food for the entire trip. Two meals we were comp'd included 2 cocktails, as well.

The weather wasn't the greatest and the river was down while we were there, so the river taxis and the riverboat ride offered by the hotel were not running but we did wander up the walkway along the river one day. Another day, we spent almost all day at one of the roulette tables - the dealers were excellent - funny, eager to please and helpful. We had a terrific time - they rotate dealers every 15 minutes so we saw them all repeatedly. That evening, we had dinner in the Prime Rib Room, a treat as always.
reviews.title: Not what you'd expect from On-line reviews
Looking forward to our next trip to Don Laughlin Riverside Hotel
reviews.text: We love the Riverside. It isn't for everyone, but it is perfect for us. Some people may not find it fancy enough. The Bellagio it ain't. But we find it a really pleasurable place to be, we are comfortable with it, there is a lot to do (go through the antique car exhibits they have - terrific, and the employees are always terrific. And you cannot beat the price - your airfare includes your stay in the hotel - and the comps do add up, as well.
We can't wait for the next charter flight from Little Rock.
reviews.title: Charter From Hell

reviews.text: The casino at Riverside is the shabbiest, ugliest one in Laughlin.
reviews.title: Has some nice points, but casino is shabby
Where we ALWAYS stay!
reviews.text: But, there are some amenities here found no where else in town. The Riverside has a movie theater, a bowling alley, and a classic car museum. No other hotel in Laughlin has any of these things.
There is also a live theater that is the closest Laughlin has to a Las Vegas Show. But the performers who have shows here are usually oldtimers who can't draw a crowd anywhere else.
reviews.title: Disgusting

reviews.text: The rooms are on a par with the rest of Laughlin. The restaurants are below par.
reviews.title: A supervised place for kids

reviews.text: One problem with the Riverside is that it is on the very end (or beginning) of the River Walk. And because of a its large parking lot on the river, it is a bit of a walk to the nearest other hotel. I like to be right in the middle of the River Walk so I can easily jump from casino to casino and take advantage of the best restaurant deals.
reviews.title: Riverside Hotel starting to slack.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: rooms are very clean .view is unmatched. price is unbeleivable for the quality,Ask for river view. hotel rooms are generally less if purchased on internet there area number of restaraunts all are very good food from economy tio gourmet theaters, bowling lanes AND EVEN A POST OFFICE ARE ALL LOCATED IN THE COMPLEX
reviews.title: the RIVERSIDE REALLY IS RIVERSIDE

reviews.text: I guess we were expecting more for a Resort. No room service, older rooms, A/C didn't work very well.No fitness center, bar at the pool was closed.Staff not very helpful when asking about off site locations of things to do and places to go. Gourmet Room does have a great 1/2 price Happy Hour starting at 5:00pm. This is not advertised anywhere that we saw.We were told by others that had stayed there. The view from the Gourmet Room is fantastic. Don't waste your time with dinner in The Prime rib Room unless you like buffet food with no flavor.
reviews.title: Not much of a Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You get what you pay for. Think about another hotel if going to Laughlin. Also it is a much older crowd.
reviews.title: Typical for Laughlin, needs customer service help

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I found myself back in Laughlin so quickly. Some dear friends of ours planned a trip themselves and asked us along. They chose the Riverside Resort and since we had not stayed there before, we decided to give it a try.
reviews.title: We had an almost perfect trip.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were only planning on spending one night with them, but as it turned out we were able to take off early. I called the hotel before we left to see if the executive suite we had reserved was available early. As it turned it, it was not. So I asked for any king room. They said they could accommodate us and they could also put us right down the hall from the room we had reserved for the next night so we could make an easy transition. We decided to leave early and arrived about 10:00 p.m.
reviews.title: Great time/deal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is a little outdated, but not bad for the money. I would suggest not eating at any of the restaurants...the food was very low quality. After eating a few meals there we ate at other casinos in the area. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. The hotel is like a mini city...bowling alley, car show, nightly entertainment, arcade for the kids and a movie theater.
reviews.title: Not Bad

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just got back from a Mon-Fri trip from DFW to Laughlin, booked on Don Laughlin's Riverside website. Just $179 at the time of booking, included flight and room. The whole trip was well organized and went very smoothly. Once at the Bullhead City, AZ airport, the busses were waiting to take us the 3 minute ride just across the Colorado River to the Casino/hotel. Checkin was very easy. Give your last name and they give you an envelope with players cards, room keys, coupons, etc. Be sure and go to the players club to "activate" your card. Once you play and accumulate 50 points, you get a free buffet. There is also a cafe with good deals on hotdogs. Although a bit smokey at times, the casino has a wide variety of games, and a poker room, and there is a large non-smoking section. Be sure and check out Don's classic car collection (free).
reviews.title: Great value for the gambler

reviews.text: The two closest casinos are the Aquarius (old Flamingo) and the Edgewater, both nice. I would consider all the casinos (except Harrah's) within walking distance if you're under 60 yoa. I found the western styled "Pioneer" to have loose slots, and I did hit a $400 jackpot on a dollar 5XPay machine at the Riverside. Be sure and take the $10 (2/1 coupon in check-in packet) ride up and down the river on the USS Riverside boat to see the area and learn some facts about the place.
reviews.title: Positive experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If your flight leaves after the normal checkout time (11AM), you have an automatic late checkout added for your convenience. Busses take you and your luggage back across to the airport, and the whole trip goes quite smoothly. I'll be going back.
reviews.title: Perfect place to unwind!

reviews.text: We have a saying in Texas; He would complain if they hanged him with a new rope.
reviews.title: Great food, friendly people, and a great get-away.
headed back tomarrow!
reviews.text: We went to the resort last year and we had a blast! Food was great and the service was wonderful. Best of all is that they offer the players club which allows you to get comp food and stays. We are now going back for another free trip! flight and hotel are included in the trip and because we enjoy gambleing most food is comped too! With all the attractions at the casino itself- auto display, theater, night clubs..and so much more it is was one of the best places to go to rest and play all in the same day and place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was my first trip to Don Laughlin’s Riverside Resort and Casino…but, certainly will not be my last. Laughlin, Nevada is a nice change of pace to Las Vegas and has the friendliness of a small town (which it is).
reviews.title: First trip to Laughlin...but not my last!

reviews.text: My wife and I were looking for an affordable getaway during the summer months and found it with the Riverside Resort’s online package deals. Our visit was from Sunday, July 18 through Thursday, July 22, 2010. The package price, per person, was just $199 for roundtrip airfare and four night’s accommodations! We left Minneapolis, MN, at 6 a.m. on Sunday and arrived on schedule (at the Bullhead City, AZ, airport) and were at the Riverside before 9 a.m. Due to it being Sunday, and a full hotel on Saturday night, we were told that our room keys would not be ready until Noon and luggage would be delivered to our room no later than 3 p.m. – both promises were kept and it was nice to leave the airport and let the Riverside bell staff handle your luggage. However, when you depart the hotel, you are responsible for bringing your luggage to the bus and taking from the bus into the airport.
reviews.title: Most Fun Ever!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Riverside Resort, as with most of the casino resorts in Laughlin, are situated alongside the Colorado River. Our room, as promised when our reservation was made, was in their South Tower on the 17th floor and overlooked the Colorado River and Arizona. The room itself was clean and nicely appointed with a king-sized bed and larger bathroom. Not that I was going to watch a lot of TV but it was nice to have a full selection of cable channels…something you don’t get in Vegas. The air conditioning worked perfectly (whew!) and is controlled for efficiency with a room key slot near the door.
reviews.title: Great Customer Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Riverside Resort has everything you’ll need during a casino getaway and more! Full casino…smoking and non-smoking; large bingo hall; beauty salon and massage service; 6-plex movie theatre; game room; five deluxe restaurants/buffets and three snack bars; classic car display; sports book; 34-lane bowling alley, two swimming pools…what else? I can’t remember everything they offer. All I know is I didn’t “want” for anything during our stay and did not need to leave the facility unless curiosity to see other parts of the “strip” called.
reviews.title: I LOVE THIS PLACE

description: Casino resort with RV park across the street.
